square.power

Class Power

  • java.lang.Object
    • square.power.Power
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MovableEffect
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PowerFail, RegularPower

    public abstract class Power
extends java.lang.Object
implements MovableEffect
    Power class.

    vincent

      • Power

        public Power(int turns,
     int actions)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a power.
        Parameters:
        turns - Amount of turns the power will last.
        actions - Amount of acitons the power will last.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when given turns,actions are invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • isLifeSpanLonger

        public boolean isLifeSpanLonger(Power power)
        Compares another power and checks if its lifespan is longer.
        Parameters:
        power -
        Returns:
        True if the given power has longer lifespan. False if the given power has a shorter lifespan.

      • isValidTurns

        public static boolean isValidTurns(int turns)
        Checks if the given turns are valid.
        Parameters:
        turns -
        Returns:
        True If the turns are >= 0 False If the turns given are < 0

      • isValidActions

        public static boolean isValidActions(int actions)
        Checks if the given actions are valid.
        Parameters:
        actions -
        Returns:
        True If the given actions are >= 0 False If the actions are < 0.

      • getPowerFailure

        public static Power getPowerFailure()
        Returns a new power failure. This failure has two children with different lifespans.
        Returns:
        Power A primary power failure.

      • getRegularPower

        public static Power getRegularPower()
        Returns a new regular power which lasts infinite life span.

      • getRemainingTurns

        public int getRemainingTurns()
        Returns the remaining turns.

      • getRemainingActions

        public int getRemainingActions()
        Returns the remaining actions.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks if the power is still active.
        Returns:
        True If the remaining actions or turns are > 0 False If the remaining actions and turns are <= 0

      • decreaseTurn

        public void decreaseTurn()
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Decreases the remaining turns by 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the turns reaches 0 or less an exception is thrown, indicating the power must be removed or renewed.

      • decreaseAction

        public void decreaseAction()
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Decreases the remaining actions by 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the actions reaches 0 or less, an exception is thrown, indicating the power must be removed or renewed.

      • reset

        protected void reset(int turns,
         int actions)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Resets the power's remaining actions and turns. This is used when the power has ended and must be renewed.
        Parameters:
        turns - the number of turns
        actions - the number of actions
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when given turns,actions are invalid.

      • setChild

        protected void setChild(Power power)
        Sets the child of a power.
        Parameters:
        power - the power

      • setParent

        protected void setParent(Power power)
        Sets the parent of the power.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.ArrayList<Power> getChildren()
        Returns the power itself and its nodes.

      • hasChild

        public boolean hasChild()
        Checks if the power has a child power. Child powers are related to the current power.
        Returns:
        True If there is a child. False If there is no child.

      • hasParent

        public boolean hasParent()
        Checks if the power has a parent power.
        Returns:
        True If there is a parent. False If there is no parent.

      • getChild

        public Power getChild()
        Returns the child if there is one.
        Returns:
        Null If no child. Power If the power has a child.

      • getParent

        public Power getParent()
        Returns the power's parent.
        Returns:
        Null If the power has no parent. Power If the power has a parent.

      • getRotation

        public Rotation getRotation()
        Returns the rotation in which the power is rotating. Not all powers rotate so this may be null.
        Returns:
        Null Rotation

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Direction direction)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the direction the power is facing from the parent.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the power
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the direction is not appropriate for this power. (no parent)

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Returns the direction the power is facing from the parent.
        Returns:
        Null If the power has no parent. Direction

      • isFailing

        public abstract boolean isFailing()
        Checks if the power has power or if it is experiencing a power failure.
        Returns:
        True If power failure. False If regular power state.

      • resetCount

        public abstract void resetCount()
        Resets the turns and actions.
